articles.title: Diner gets big (screen) idea to keep serving in the pandemic
articles.description: The Bel Aire Diner in Queens, New York, has been open 24/7 for decades. But when the pandemic threatened to force them to close their doors, they came up with a novel idea for the empty parking lot next door -- make it a drive-in and serve food to the patrons.
articles.content:
Queens, New York (CNN)Nothing has tested the slogan "always open" like Covid-19, even at venerable diners like the Bel Aire in Queens, New York, which hasn't locked the doors in decades.

articles.title: Record unhappiness reigns as Americans think something has gone awry in US

articles.title: Paulinho Paiakan, Amazon chief and indigenous rainforest protector, dies aged 66
